articles.content:
Russian Defence Minister on DPRK's nuclear problem 
    Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- Russian Defence Minister Sergei Ivanov on Monday reportedly said that the DPRK's "nuclear programs" themselves do not necessarily mean nuclear weapons and nuclear power is vital to its existence in particular.
 The problem must be dealt with by diplomatic means only at present and it is premature to bring up this matter for discussion at the un security council, he said.    
 He stressed that it is necessary to provide the DPRK with guarantees of security, otherwise, the situation could be unpredictable.

articles.content:
Malaysia opposes efforts to isolate DPRK over nuclear issue 
    Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- Malaysian Foreign Minister Syed Hamid Albar reportedly said Monday in reference to the DPRK's "nuclear crisis" that any approach such as efforts to isolate Pyongyang would not be right and would not work.
 So the best way is to be engaged in a very constructive way, he said, adding that the issue should be solved through negotiations and talks between the various parties involved.

DPRK FM sends letter to UNSC president
articles.content:
DPRK FM sends letter to UNSC president
    Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun mailed a letter to the president of the UN Security Council today as regards the DPRK's withdrawal from the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT).
 In the letter, Paek recalled that the DPRK Government declared on March 12, 1993, its withdrawal from the NPT and, through the DPRK-U.S. joint statement dated June 11, 1993, decided to "unilaterally suspend as long as it considers it necessary" the effectuation of the DPRK's withdrawal from the NPT one day before the coming into effect of its withdrawal.    
 Informing that the DPRK Government decided on January 10, 2003 to revoke the suspension on the effectuation of its withdrawal from the NPT, he stated that the DPRK's withdrawal would be effectuated from January 11, 2003, the following day after the submission of this letter to the UNSC.
